intro: Gambeya subnuda, commonly known as the naked gambeya, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, glossy leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, yellowish-green flowers that bloom during the wet season. Gambeya subnuda is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance. It prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it suitable for tropical and subtropical gardens.
